dialogue: Well well. Isn't this a rare sight.
Hey, lil' bro. What are you doing here?
Hey, big sis!
Where's mom and dad?
Well...they went on a trip earlier today.
Okay...? And...why are you in the kitchen now?
Hehe.
You're talking to this store's stand-in manager.
Huh?
Wait, what? You're kidding.
Nope.
You? Being in charge of the store?
Hey! What's with that look on your face!
I volunteered out of good will okay?
Haha, nice try.
I bet you just volunteered cuz' you spent all of your savings.
Wow. Just wow. Am I that sort of duck in your eyes?
Yes.
Ouch. No hesitation at all huh...
Do you even remember your way around the kitchen?
Maybe? That's why I'm here now aren't I? To familiarise myself?
Maybe? What do you mean by maybe?
*Sigh*
Just to make sure that you're not going to burn the whole store down, do you want me to give you a crash course of the kitchen?
(Hm...do I need a hand?)
Yep! Much appreciated!
Alright.
Nah, I got this.
Alright...
But! Just in case, I'll leave this guidebook to you.
At any point in time where you feel lost, you can use it!
Good luck!
Here. Take this.
This is a guidebook that I have consolidated specifically for you.
It essentially has everything you need to know.
At any point in time where you feel lost, you can use it!
But first, take your time to digest everything in this book.
And also, practise makes perfect! Make use of the time that you have now to practise the things listed in the book!
If you have anything that you don't understand, you can ask me anytime!
Oh! I take it as you have something to talk about?
As you go about your day, orders from customers will slowly trickle in.
Our store's motto is to serve those who came first, and quickly too!
Take too much time, or serve the wrong order, and the customer will get angry!
Trust me, you don't want that to happen.
In the case where that happens, you will likely suffer from a small penalty, so do take extra care to do it right!
Is there anything else you want to talk about?
Haha. Very funny.
As of now, you only need to worry about making salads.
Our store's menu consists of 3 different types of salads: salad, tomato salad and shrimp salad.
Simply cut the required ingredients on a chopping board, and place them in a salad plate.
And viola! You got yourself a salad that is ready to be served to customers!
Sounds simple enough right?
Is there anything else you want to talk about?
The ingredients?
Our ingredients are very obviously limited.
Keep using them, and our ingredients stock will run out, you see.
So yes. You have to continuously replenish them throughout the day.
Quite inefficient, if you ask me.
I asked mom and dad countless times to just bulk order their ingredients, but they said they wanted them fresh.
They're the boss here, so we just have to deal with it I guess.
Is there anything else you want to talk about?
Ah yes, our store's literal lifeline.
Why? It's in charge of replenishing our ingredients.
As you know, our ingredients are limited, so we have to replenish them constantly.
And this is where our friendly neighbourhood drone comes in.
You can basically tell it to retrieve new ingredients for you while you work.
But cut it some slack would you?
There's only one of it here, so it can only help you to retrieve a few ingredients per trip.
It's getting pretty old too, so there's bound to be some wear and tear.
With each restocking trip it does, it gets abit more...worn out.
Good news is that mom and dad are aware.
The not so good news is that this issue is still very much here.
For now, mom and dad has installed a tracker for how worn out the drone gets.
It looks like a progress bar of sorts, and the nore filled it gets, the more worn out the drone is, I guess
Leave it be, and it will eventually break down.
So, to prevent that, you have to constantly perform maintenance on it.
Anyways, it shouldn't be too tall of a task for you. The maintenance is quite simple, to be honest.
Even I can do it.
Is there anything else you want to talk about?
*Yawn*
Yeah...it's getting late too. I'll head back to my room first. 'Night!
Oh, wow.
Hey, big sis!
I wouldn't know how you did today, considering that I was out all day, but...
I guess the you're not as bad as I thought, considering that the kitchen isn't on fire!
What can I say? I'm a natural in everything I do!
Haha. Sure thing.
Anyways, I should probably tell you that mom and dad's orders are here.
What?
What orders?
Don't tell me you forgot when you're the one who helped them order it!
Haha...oops?
*Sigh*
Does new ingredients and cooking equipment ring a bell to you?
Oh yeah!
I can't believe you...
Anyways, can you pass me your manual for a sec?
Sure thing!
Hm...and...done!
Here! I updated your manual!
You can now look up information about the new ingredients and cooking equipment!
But really...
Will you really be okay in the next few days?
How about making use of the time now to get used to the new ingredients and cooking equipment?
(New ingredients and equipment, huh...)
(Do I need to familiarise myself with them?)
Sure thing!
Nah, I'm fine!
I'll stay and watch to make sure that you don't burn down the kitchen.
If you want to talk, feel free to approach me!
Hm? What is it?
Ah, yes. The new cooking equipments.
New cooking equipment means being able to cook more things.
That pot in particular is meant to be used for cooking soup.
Simply put 3 prepared ingredients in the pot and then put the pot on the stove.
After a while, you'll get soup! Simple, right?
Is there anything else you want to talk about?
Ah, that.
Now, instead of having one plate for all, we now have specialized plates and bowls for our food.
For instance, the salad belongs in the salad bowl, and of course, the soup belongs to the soup bowl.
Makes thing much clearer and easier to differentiate.
Is there anything else you want to talk about?
Haha. Very funny.
*Yawn*
Yeah...it's getting late too. I'll head back to my room first. 'Night!
Oh, you mean the soup?
It's quite a simple process, really.
First, you take the required ingredients to the cutting station and chop them up.
Then, put all of them into an empty pot.
Pop it on a stove for some time, and after it's done cooking, pour the soup into a soup bowl.
And viola! You got yourself a soup that is ready for consumption!
Got that down?
Is there anything else you want to talk about?
Hey, lil bro!
It's me again! Along with new stuff!
"New stuff"? Don't tell me...
Yep! New ingredients and cooking equipment!
Haha! What's with that face!
Couldn't they arrive after mom and dad comes back?
I'm barely managing as it is!
Woah! What's this?
You're gonna chicken out?
It's only been 2 days!
Well, no.
But it is getting a little tiring.
Now you know how hard mom and dad has to work everyday!
Doesn't that make you want to help out more often?
Hm. No, not really.
Anyways, there's quite abit of stuff outside, so if you want to practise using them again, you have to help me out!
(Do I want to practise?)
Alright, alright.
Alright! Let's go now!
Haha. You're on your on with this one.
...You cheeky brat!
Haha! See you later!
Wait! Before you go, give me your manual.
Huh?
Oh, here.
Hm...okay!
Here. Have it back.
I took stock of the new stuff outside just now and updated your manual according to them.
Now you can look it up in your manual!
That should be the last of them!
Now that eveything's out of the way...
You can now practise using the new ingredients and cooking equipment as much as you want!
I'll leave you to your own devices, but as per usual, I'll be right here if you want to chat!
Hm? What is it?
The frying pan?
Well, like its name suggests, it literally is your average frying pan.
It fries specific ingredients such as the new ingredient, the meat.
Simply put 1 ingredient in the frying pan and pop it on the stove.
After a while, and viola! The ingredient is cooked.
Isn't that simple?
Is there anything else you want to talk about?
Haha. Very funny.
*Yawn*
Yeah...it's getting late too. I'll head back to my room first. 'Night!
Oh, you mean the burger?
It takes quite aa while to make, so listen carefully!
First, you take the required ingredients to the cutting station and chop them up. Remember that the bread does not need to be cut!
Put the chopped meat into an emtpy frying pan.
Pop it on a stove for some time.
After it's done cooking, transfer it into a burger plate, along with all other required ingredients.
And viola! You got yourself a soup that is ready for consumption!
Is there anything else you want to talk about?
Hey, lil bro!
Hm?
Just wanted to check up on how you're doing, since it's been a few days since mom and dad has left the store to you.
Oh! I'm doing quite fine actually!
It's actually not as dull and boring as I initially thought!
I could get used to this!
Really? Then you should help around more hm?
Haha. No thanks.
Anyways, what brings you here, big sis?
More orders again?
Nope.
Oh, thank god.
Anymore and I'll actually get psychological trauma from just hearing the word trauma.
Haha! Good news then.
I just got a call from mom and dad.
They're at the airport now.
Yay! They're finally back!
With souvenirs, I hope!
Let's go!
Ah! Wait up!
Ah, the cutting station?
Like what the name suggests, it literally is where you cut you ingredients in the kitchen.
Simply put an ingredient on it, and chop away!
Is there anything else you want to talk about?
